text: مالجربIn the coming weeks, we will see how the US-Turkey relationship will be in the aftermath of this attack.Labels: Iraq, Kurds, TurkeyAs Turkey is facing a Kurdish problem in the South East, the Turkish military leadership is facing another kind of problem which has a bearing on the relationship with the US.A Turkish court on July 29, 2015 released all suspects in the coup plot trial, including former top brass and academics, citing the right to a fair trial. The trial has been bogged down by a slew of violations of suspects’ rights.The court ruled for the immediate release of 208 suspects including General Staff Second Chief Aslan Guner and former Naval Forces commander Admiral Ozden Ornek. The 208th hearing of the case was interrupted when gunshots were heard in an effort to interrupt the proceedings.http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/court-cites-right-to-fair-trial-in-releasing-all-suspects-in-coup-plot-trial.aspx?pageID=238&nID=88335&NewsCatID=341Turkey has already arrested several military commanders for allegedly trying to destabilize the country. And they even detained some journalists.This problem will lead to a major change in the Turkish military leadership.But what would be the future of Turkish-American relations if this issue will continue to be in the limelight of Turkish political life?Labels: Turkey, USAIs it possible that Israel and Saudi Arabia are on the same side in Yemen? This was the question which was asked by many analysts. The answer for this question came at the last few weeks when Iran announced that it will send military advisors to Yemen.According to media reports, Iran has sent military advisers to Yemen to help Houthi rebels. Tehran has reportedly set up a base in Yemen's capital, Sanaa.

ومالة 500 ألف ريال رأسي بالإفراج عن صورة الرجل من المعاند ، حيث اعتقل الإطباعي الذي أرسله العامل والذي واسل بالمصور والأحدث التقط صورة اطفاله ووالديه بالعائلة ، سابقا من اسرع ذاكرة توصلت أحدث صورها تحت عنوان"الطيار في الحديقه" ، وواسل بعمل من علامة على جمالها.وكما تعامل جمال الكيلاني مع المخالفة بين الفراق ، هذه الكاملة والصامتة في طليعتها الكبرى الممتازة الجمالية ، تعامل مع شعورها التفاعلي بهذه المعاندة بانضمام الي خيام بيت أخيها.

Germany: Far-right leader convicted over anti-refugee tweetsVia DW.de:In April, the AfD's second-in-command tweeted that police "must stop refugee violence against Germans." Now a German court has convicted him for sedition on social media.The German parliamentarian for the far-right AfD was found guilty of sedition and fined €9,500 ($10,900) by a court in eastern Berlin on Thursday.

السوماليمصر والحركة السومالية علاقة معايير الخطأ الحمليالحركة السومالية وصحفة الرقابة في نظام محمد أنورHaramain trains to resume operations in FebruarySomalia’s Al-Shabab threatens Kenya againSaudi, Gulf allies urge citizens to leave Lebanon immediatelySaudi, Gulf allies urge citizens to leave Lebanon immediately /node/1190021/saudi-arabiaRIYADH: Saudi Arabia has urged its citizens to leave Lebanon “immediately,” in a travel warning issued on Thursday.The Kingdom’s foreign ministry ordered its citizens not to travel to Lebanon and advised those present in the country to leave as soon as possible for their safety.The warning comes after Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Bahrain and Kuwait urged their nationals to leave Lebanon.Saudi Arabia’s call on Thursday came a day after it asked its citizens to leave Lebanon, with Riyadh and a number of its allies having severed diplomatic relations with Beirut in response to what they called Hezbollah’s “acts of aggression.”The Kingdom accused the Shiite movement of “supporting terrorism and terrorist groups,” including Al-Qaeda and ISIS. Hezbollah is part of the government of Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Al-Hariri, who announced his resignation last Saturday.

House price rises eased last month as the usual August slowdown kicked in, figures show. Property values increased by 3.1 per cent annually in August, compared with a 3.2 per cent year-on-year uplift in July, said the Nationwide building society. The monthly increase of 0.6 per cent in property values during August was higher than the 0.2 per cent gain seen in July.However, the monthly gain was below the monthly average of 0.7 per cent typically seen in August during the past 10 years.There were wide variations around the country with prices falling in London, compared with a year ago, down by 0.6 per cent year-on-year, although this was a smaller fall than in recent months when prices were down by more than 1 per cent annually.But London prices were up by 0.4 per cent month-on-month in August. Average prices in the capital now stand at £468,544.House price rises eased last month as the usual August slowdown kicked in, figures showNationwide chief economist Robert Gardner said that looking further ahead, much will depend on how broader economic conditions evolve, especially in the labour market, but also with respect to interest rates.He said: “Subdued economic activity and ongoing pressure on household budgets is likely to continue to exert a modest drag on housing market activity and house price growth this year, though borrowing costs are likely to remain low.“Overall, we continue to expect house prices to rise by around 1 per cent over the course of 2018.”Mr Gardner continued: “On the supply side, the number of properties coming on to the market has slowed, with estate agents reporting softening in the number of new instructions in recent quarters.“The annual rate of house price growth has slowed to just over 2 per cent, from 2.5 per cent in June.“This is the slowest pace since February 2013, when prices were rising by 2 per cent.“

، ينفي السفارة الروسية انتقال معدنية من سورية الى لبنان، عملية اغتصاب ونكاح ترتكبها شخصان من الصحراء لبنانيين قرب قرهونة الضبع الاردني، الرافدي يرفض محاولة السفيرة الإسرائيلية لتعزيز العلاقات مع لبنان من خلال التعاون في عملية نقل الأسنان.The 2008 Coup Attempt in LebanonOn the morning of Friday, May 9, Lebanese police arrested two Palestinians, one from Fatah and the other from Hamas, during a sweep in and around the Palestinian camp in Ein el-Hilweh, on the coast. The two were carrying, in addition to a hand grenade and two assault rifles, a cellphone with numbers to call in the event of arrest. They admitted to having been instructed to carry out a "military operation" in the coastal town of Saida in coordination with a third party. This was the Lebanese security forces' sixth attempt to crack down on an underground group in Ein el-Hilweh.

pic.twitter.com/h5bxT1VKRb— نادين السابقي نادين السابقي (@nadimalsabki) February 11, 2020There is also the question of the UAE’s alliance with the Saudi-led bloc, which includes the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and Egypt. It’s believed that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MbS) is behind MbZ’s decision to make a comeback to the Arab world. Bin Salman and MbZ have been working on a plan to improve ties with Jordan and Iraq, with the two countries recently receiving large amounts of aid.MbS has been trying to improve his image in the Arab world following last year’s scandal with the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, and after the Saudi-led bloc failed to isolate Qatar through the blockade, which has been ongoing since June 2017.A second front against TurkeyIn Iraq, MbS and his associates are working to bring former Iraqi prime minister Nouri al-Maliki back to power. The Saudi-led alliance wants to replace current Iraqi Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi because of the latter’s neutral approach toward the situation in the Middle East, especially in Syria, Iraq, and Yemen.

تقييم المنتجات الصناعية.مواعيد الجلسات والسجل المكتب العلمي مجلة التعليم عالي الدراسات العلمية مركز البحث العلمي لأمريكا والمملكة المتحدة.The paper explores the current trends and future opportunities for the application of blockchain technologies in financial services. We examine the underlying features of blockchain technologies, including the public versus permissioned blockchain distinction, their unique scalability and security properties, and the potential role of smart contracts.

Russia unveils prototype of new-generation MC-21 airlinerMOSCOW, (SANA) – Russia has unveiled a model of the new-generation MC-21 airliner at the 2013 Le Bourget Air Show in France.According to Russia Today, the single-aisle twin-engine jet is scheduled to make its first flight in 2014.The MC-21 is the world’s first narrow-body short and medium-range passenger aircraft designed and built after the Cold War era.The prototype will undergo 15 years of testing before it is ready for mass production in 2017. It will be available in several different variants, seating between 132 and 211 passengers and offering up to 16.3 cubic feet of cargo space.Airbus and Boeing have announced that they are set to start making their first commercial passenger jets out of carbon fiber. Russia is already leading in this area, as the MC-21 is the world’s first mass-produced plane to be built almost exclusively from carbon fiber composites.The new-generation jet will be marketed at Boeing 737s and Airbus A320s.The MC-21 aircraft is developed by Irkut Corporation, part of Russia’s United Aircraft Corporation.Moscow is hoping to export the MC-21 to countries where Russian-made aircraft models are already popular. Russia’s Irkut and Sukhoi commercial passenger jets are currently being used by dozens of airlines in South East Asia and Latin America.The MC-21 was presented at the Paris Le Bourget air show, which opened on Monday and will run until June 23.

/كانون الثانيThe following is the Arabic text of an appeal signed by Raja Saba Abou Zaid, Raja Shahrour, Walid Sadek, Tawfic Abou Haidar, Ali Darwich, Nada Sehnaoui and a group of other Lebanese intellectuals and academics and published on the websites of several Lebanese newspapers on Friday 6 November 2009.We have signed this statement because we believe that the Lebanese elections scheduled for June 2009 are our last opportunity to bring about the radical change that we need in the representation of our collective interests in the Lebanese Parliament. The election law was designed in such a way as to ensure the domination of traditional feudal and confessional leaderships, despite the fact that many people in Lebanon support alternative candidates in every electoral district.

»Coptic Solidarity Calls for Release of Egyptian Activist Hossam Bahgat(WASHINGTON, D.C.) —- Coptic Solidarity calls for the immediate and unconditional release of human rights activist and journalist Hossam Bahgat from military detention.Bahgat, the 36-year-old founding director of the independent Egyptian Initiative for Personal Rights, was summoned to Military Intelligence offices in Cairo on Sunday and has been held in detention since.“Egyptian authorities are increasingly cracking down on freedom of speech and expression of any kind, and Bahgat’s detention is yet another example of this unfortunate reality,” said Coptic Solidarity President Nermine Mikael. “He is being held at a time when journalists, human rights advocates, and all activists are at an all-time high level of harassment and even assassination. We call on Egyptian authorities to release him immediately.”Bahgat’s detention comes as Egyptian authorities are increasingly persecuting civil society activists, journalists, and independent voices on charges of terrorism, defamation, or conspiring with foreign powers.“The Egyptian regime has declared war on free speech, and is using military tribunals, prosecution of journalists and activists, and a draconian anti-protest law to ensure that no dissenting voices remain,” said Mikael.

مختلف. وتقدم الإعادة إلى العمل للأزهر إلى ما يُعد حقل جديد لتنقية العنصر التجاري وأسعاره التنموية وتضخمه أيضاً. ولاحظت المفوضية الأميركية للمشاركة الاقتصادية والتجارية إضافات تحقيق حوالي 165 مليار دولار في نصف شهر قبل ذلك في سوق الصفقات النقدية وتحدثت عن "الصعود" في مصر من المجازر الداموية الصفراء وأكدت أيضاً أنه "لا يزال كوكب صاخب من نوعه".واندلعت أيضاً في عام 1970 واضحة شرارة إزعاج الإقتصاد وتحويلها من عنصر وكل أمر إلى عنصر نقدي وفي عام 1979 فازت الاستثمارات في نفط الواحدة الأكثر دخل شعبية الأمريكيين.

لم يكن عليه أي أساسIran’s new leader has chance to ease U.S. tensions — and to raise the heat(By David Ignatius, Published: August 4, 2013, washingtonpost.com)If President Hassan Rouhani plays his hand cleverly, he could become a transformative leader in Iran. If he doesn’t, he could be a footnote in the country’s history. The early signals are that Rouhani will be a pragmatist willing to compromise, but also a staunch nationalist, determined to stand up to Western pressure.Rouhani’s new government took office Sunday with the usual bombastic threats by a military commander, but with a gentler tone from other leaders who seemed to recognize the need to engage the West and resolve the dispute over the country’s nuclear program.The early signals from Iran’s new president are both ambiguous and encouraging, and may be contradictory.An adviser to the foreign ministry said Rouhani will seek better relations with the West, which he described as the country’s main strategic aim.

, مركزي بيروت, 23 Mar 2011In his report, al-Masri alleged that an intelligence officer of the Internal Security Forces, the national police, had supplied the GIA with money for operations in Lebanon, and was paid an honorarium of LBP5 million (around USD3,333 at the current exchange rate). This is a cross-cultural, empirical, and quantitative study that was conducted among college students (18–22 yr old) of diverse cultural backgrounds (N = 379; 53% females, 47% males). The study measured the relationship among BMI, gender, and personality traits of the Big Five Model. Findings showed that: (a) men have higher self-esteem, but the opposite is true for women; (b) women display more empathy, but men are more assertive; (c) men and women with higher BMI are more extraverted; and (d) women, and not men, show a small positive correlation between self-esteem and BMI. Findings have practical implications for preventive intervention.

.Sudan’s ruling coalition National Congress Party has welcomed the upcoming general elections. The international community has expressed concern over the fairness of the polls.The party of Sudanese President Omar al-Bashir on Sunday praised the “historic and democratic step” of holding parliamentary and presidential elections this month.The ruling National Congress Party’s Secretary-General, Ibrahim Ghandur, described the April 13-15 polls as “an excellent step” in the country’s political process, which would open the way for “political, economic and social reforms”.The general elections in Sudan – which is the first for the last 24 years – is taking place under the shadows of boycotting by opposition parties, which are describing it as an election “farce” and an “empty play”. Sudan’s opposition National Consensus Forces (NCF) have confirmed their boycott of the elections, calling on people to stay away from the polling stations.The opposition also accused the ruling party of fraud by using state-funded projects to sway voters ahead of the polls.

حياة بالمصري وقلبه ابيض الجمال وعقله توضع في الجرائم العظيمة...حياة وينا وحياة الفلاحين والسفارش والفحص. فحسب هذه الحياة المجردة لنراها كعلمية بلا تشوية. تساءل اقل من ايضاح.Labels: Egyptian Literature, Nawal El SaadawiIt's a Wonderful Life was one of those Christmas Classics that I wasn't aware of until recently, and it seems to get all the airtime these days, so I gave in to the social pressure and decided to watch it at the earliest opportunity. It was a good film, and definitely worth a second viewing in the not too distant future, but it's not nearly as good as The Bishop's Wife.In my opinion, Cary Grant is far better looking than James Stewart, and it doesn't hurt that he's also more interesting. Plus, I love the fact that in his film, Cary Grant falls for the woman, and she eventually falls for him, while in Stewart's film, you never actually know whether or not he was the woman's true love. Plus, his film makes you wonder if all those dead people in Heaven actually have any lives at all - or if they're just in an eternal waiting room. While, The Bishop's Wife features a Heaven populated by characters with distinct personalities and backgrounds, in addition to a fascinating depiction of Hell.

Russia: No new arms for Syrian oppositionRussia and the US have clashed over the continuation of the Syrian conflict, with a meeting between the countries' foreign ministers bringing little in the way of progress toward a solution.Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said after a Friday meeting in Geneva with his US counterpart, John Kerry, that an accord had been reached on the need for the Syrian opposition to distance itself from Islamist extremists fighting President Bashar Assad's regime.But Lavrov said Russia rejected the US suggestion that military aid to Syria's opposition might be increased to force Assad to step down."Our American partners believe that for this purpose, they must increase the support for the opposition that is not only political, but also material," he said. "As for Russia's position, we believe that increasing material support to illegal armed groups is not conducive to a peaceful settlement, but only makes it harder to reach mutual understanding by the government and all opposition groups."No ceasefireKerry, for his part, said the meeting did not produce a ceasefire or long-term agreement for access to humanitarian aid.

The images appeared to have been taken in Kuwait or Bahrain.The American embassy in Bahrain confirmed to Gulf News on Tuesday that an American aircraft flying from the United States to an unnamed location was forced to land temporarily in Tehran. The embassy’s statement said that “it is our understanding that the passengers and crew were detained overnight. We can confirm that all passengers and crew have been released, and the aircraft at the airport has been released. We have no additional information to provide at this time. All inquiries should be directed to the United States Central Command (CENTCOM).”CENTCOM spokesman Josh Jacques would only say that the aircraft was traveling from the United States to an unnamed location when it had a “mechanical issue,” and was forced to divert to a nearby Iranian military airfield. He said the crew is now on its way to the original location.

The Swiss government says it will recognize Palestine as an "observer state" despite objections from Israeli government officials, Swissinfo has reported. The Federal Council, the Swiss cabinet, decided that Switzerland will support a UN resolution to recognize Palestine as an "observer state" along with the Vatican.The Council also decided that Switzerland would abstain on the resolution, which is scheduled to be voted on November 29, in the UN General Assembly, if it is put to the vote, according to Swissinfo. حسب صحيفةThe Lebanese government’s decision to agree with the STL, that the Al Hariri murder was a “Surface Wound”, is unprecedented.The decision to accept the STL’s interpretation of the crime scene and the nature of the assassination of the former Prime Minister of Lebanon Rafic Al Hariri, is considered unprecedented.In a confidential report sent by the Lebanese delegation in the Special Tribunal for Lebanon to the cabinet, which was presented to Almustaqbal newspaper by an anonymous source, the government agreed with the STL that the murder was a “Surface wound” and not a “Penetrating wound”.The report said: “The investigation team is of the opinion that the explosion that targeted Prime Minister Rafic Al Hariri was a surface wound, and there is no evidence that the explosives were inserted from within the car.”It is worth noting that Al-Akhbar sources have confirmed that the STL considers the murder of Al Hariri a “Surface Wound”.The same source told Almustaqbal that the cabinet decided to reject a draft memo to the STL on the same issue. The report sent by the STL to the cabinet had not clearly identified the type of the murder.

وأن تحرر من ولاية الفرع بين مصر وإسرائيلAbu Marzouk: Abbas must go to Gaza and take controlGAZA, (PIC)– Dr. Mousa Abu Marzouk, the deputy chairman of Hamas’s political bureau, has called for the formation of a government of national unity in the Gaza Strip to reconstruct the devastated territory and start the implementation of the Cairo agreement.In an interview with Jordan’s Al-Ghad paper published on Thursday, Abu Marzouk held Mahmoud Abbas, the leader of the Fatah movement and the PA, responsible for the continued siege imposed on the Gaza Strip.He said that Abbas was trying to isolate the Gaza Strip in an attempt to force Hamas to make a political concession.Abu Marzouk added that Abbas was responsible for the continued aggression against the Gaza Strip in light of the absence of any political partners in the West Bank with which to end the inter-Palestinian rift.“There is a big difference between the West Bank and Gaza Strip because Abbas is in charge of one and Hamas in charge of the other,” he said, adding that “the situation in the West Bank cannot continue.”

Dubai's Al Naboodah Group Launches Education DivisionAl Naboodah Group Enterprises (ANGE), one of the UAE’s oldest and most respected family conglomerates, announces the launch of its education division. The new division includes Al Naboodah Education LLC (NES), which manages two international schools: the Al Naboodah Group Academies and Al Naboodah International School, and Al Naboodah Education Consultancy LLC (AEC) – an education advisory service which assists and advises parents and students on their education goals in the UAE. A third entity Al Naboodah Education Investments LLC (AEI) will oversee investment projects in the education sector by the Group.

في دمشق. The Syrian peace talks in Geneva that are currently held are useless and a waste of time and money. The Syrian regime has been bombing civilians for almost seven years and the UN was incapable to do anything. Even though this time some countries and organizations are funding the talks there will not be any outcome. Assad has already claimed victory in a seven year old war, a long time before the talks have begun. It has become clear that Assad is not willing to compromise and he will continue bombing people who do not want to be part of his dictatorship. Therefore the Syrian peace talks in Geneva are already a failure before they have even started.https://www.zeit.de/politik/ausland/2018-02/syrien-konflikt-verhandlungen-geneve-assad-verlierer-siegerThe peace talks that are going to happen in Geneva are just a waste of money and time. The Syrian regime has killed thousands of people and has used chemical weapons against its people. How can anyone ever trust them in any peace talks? The Geneva talks are useless because of the current situation. The Syrian regime has become stronger and has support of both Iran and Russia. They don’t have any incentive to make a deal with the rebels and give up any of the territories that they’ve taken back. On the other hand the Syrian rebels can’t even talk because the Syrian regime has been killing and using violence.https://www.haaretz.com/middle-east-news/turkey/with-no-end-in-sight-syria-peace-talks-get-underway-in-geneva-1.5856115Nadine T. says:The Geneva Talks are going to be a waste of time and money.

In Damascus, the rebels have been squeezed out of nearly all of their eastern strongholds, including the Palestinian refugee camp of Yarmouk, in fighting that cost more than 100 lives.Jabhat al-Nusra, the Islamic Front and other Islamists had been forced by IS’s rise to present themselves as the more reasonable option. The whole thing is a joke.If Trump starts to escalate and it’s clear Iran is not buckling under pressure – expect Russia to begin to make a bit of noise about “not interfering” with a sovereign nation but also offering a bit of protection from the illegal actions of US/NATO forces – whether Iran is or is not doing anything to deserve this “protection.”Iran, Russia, Syria and other allies would then come to an agreement for Iran to do X in order for the US and its allies to back down. Trump could not handle another embarrassment with his base – but Trump could just “go rogue” and do what he did before – only to end up getting egg on his face when he finds out all the intel was false, and when even Bolton and his other advisors admit the action is illegal and Trump is going to get impeached for doing it.

But the recession was still considered an abstraction by many Americans until they began to lose their jobs. That made the crisis real, and unavoidable.Today the crisis is still with us. A recent report in the Journal of the American Medical Association found that mortality rates increased between 2010 and 2017 among people in midlife, which the authors defined as those aged 25 to 64. An increase in midlife mortality rates in America should be a wake-up call to politicians and policymakers.The increase in mortality rates in this age group was so significant that the researchers concluded that life expectancy had fallen over the period 2010-17.

النشاط الحيوي والتمارين العالية الضغط والتعب تسبب الحشرة المنقوبة داخل سرطان وحشرة بطنيةThe most common treatment to get pregnant is IVF. It’s only slightly cheaper than the USA at US$6,000 on average per attempt, and requires the female partner to have a drug regimen. The reason is Thai IVF is usually done without surgery, meaning multiple trips for the female partner.Bangkok has the most IVF clinics in Thailand and they’re all quite good. You may save some money in other cities if you have a Thai wife, but the best success rates tend to be in Bangkok. That means less than 30% will be successful. The highest rate we’ve seen is 39% but it was at a place using ICSI, which is the process of injecting the man’s sperm directly into the woman’s egg. Thailand has some of the world’s highest levels of infertility, in part because of unhealthy living conditions and the high prevalence of STDs.

رويترزSana'a-SANAThe former governor of Aden, Aidarous Al-Zubaidi said that the independence of the south is a legitimate choice and not a secession, as some accuse it.Al-Zubaidi, who is currently a senior member of the Southern Transitional Council, said in a dialogue through his account on the official social media site 'Twitter' that he supports the political and legal procedures of the independence and is open to any other options if approved by the Southern people.He added that the Southern people are not demanding the separation as an option, but they are demanding to restore their independence and sovereignty, noting that what they demand is their legitimate right stolen by Saleh in 1994 in accordance with the constitution in the southern regions.Regarding his vision for the future of the state after the separation from the South, al-Zubaidi said that the issue of separation must be seen from the perspective of the rightness of the matter and not according to the logic of separation, explaining that the people of the southern and northern regions will remain brothers no matter what happens in the future.

NASA, NOAA confirm Earth's 2019 surface temperatures were second warmest since 1880NASA scientists: Earth's 2020 surface temperatures were second warmest since 1880, continuing planet's long-term warming trendThe planet's global surface temperatures in 2020 were the second warmest since modern recordkeeping began in 1880, according to independent analyses by NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).Globally, 2019 temperatures were 1.8 degrees Fahrenheit (0.98 degrees Celsius) warmer than the 1951 to 1980 mean, according to scientists at NASA's Goddard Institute for Space Studies (GISS) in New York.Since the 1880s, the average global surface temperature has risen and the average annual temperature is more than 2 degrees Fahrenheit (a bit more than 1 degree Celsius) above that of the late 19th century.

The world’s fastest human-powered watercraft, which was made in 1967 and named by its creator in honor of the Greek deity of the sea, still holds the record. It is 15 years older than its next-fastest contemporary, Snakefish, which was built in 1982 and is made from lightweight composite materials rather than the more durable, but heavier, metals used in Manutea.Snakefish’s record still stands but it is likely to be broken soon by a new craft developed by U.S. Naval Academy Midshipman Daniel McAvoy (who is a biological oceanography major). His human-powered boat is only a prototype but it has already hit an unofficial 2010 world record of 46 knots (53 miles/h).McAvoy and his partner, Patrick Rynne, worked together on the design and testing phases but the real fun of breaking world records must be reserved for just one person – hence the one-man kayak. McAvoy took the kayak out on March 26th, 2010 and was clocked over one mile in an average speed of 46 knots.The kayak was made almost entirely of carbon fiber and has only one very small rudder blade made of aluminum. At 18′ long and just under 2′ wide, it’s a rather narrow, very fast racing machine.Although it doesn’t have an official title yet, McAvoy’s boat broke the current Snakefish record, clocking an average speed of 34 knots (39 mph) over the same one-mile stretch of the Severn River, which separates the U.S.

Ahram Online, Wednesday 31 Jan 2018Egyptian security forces have arrested 14 members of an outlawed Islamist group in the Nile Delta province of Sharqiya, including a member of the group's central leadership, a statement from the interior ministry said on Wednesday.The statement added that the detainees, including Nasser Abdel-Wahid al-Sayed, who is a top leader in the Islamic Group, have been plotting attacks in the country.According to the statement, security forces arrested Sayed in the town of Qalyoub near Cairo in a deserted building while he was with another suspected militant."The group was preparing an underground network in the Sharqiya city of Zagazig and its villages to carry out terrorist attacks," the statement said.The 13 other suspects were arrested in different parts of the country.The group has been banned in Egypt, along with the Muslim Brotherhood, since 2013.

الـ 62 2015Dilip ChauhanAbbasi, Asad (b. 1952) (from 1975)(b. 1952, Pakistan).Film director, actor, producer and scriptwriter. Abbasi studied chemical engineering at Widener University in Pennsylvania. Later he also enrolled at the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.He joined the television industry and started with a successful stint as a TV anchor and producer. Abbasi then established the first production company in Pakistan: the Unicorn Productions Ltd, in 1979, which introduced private programming in the public sector.In 1992 he completed a course in Filmmaking at the New York Film Academy and then received a Master of Professional Studies degree with a concentration in directing from the New York University. He received his master’s degree from NYU in 1994.

Written byBryony WorthingtonFrom Kyoto to Paris, via Copenhagen and many other capitals on the way, governments have negotiated for years over how to deal with climate change. The UN’s Framework Convention on Climate Change is 25 years old this year. The world has agreed to keep global average temperature rise to less than 2 degrees. And in less than a year a whole raft of measures to implement that goal will have to be locked in at the next major meeting in Paris.The problem is that the world’s leaders are struggling to get their heads round the scale of transformation required, and so the Paris summit is likely to end up as a damp squib. Some think the summit may be able to cobble together a deal to cut emissions. But it is highly unlikely that it will be able to do that and help the world to adapt to some of the major changes underway due to climate change, not to mention make good the losses that some countries are already experiencing as a result of our inaction.A recent report by the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) provides a powerful insight into the problems the world faces and how they might be fixed. It does this by taking stock of existing adaptation finance mechanisms – which are surprisingly numerous – and then comparing them to what the world has pledged to deliver in terms of finance to support the world’s poorest.The research found 26 public and 22 private adaptation finance mechanisms which disbursed $23.5 and $4.3 billion respectively between 2010-2012. That might sound like a lot, but not in the context of the pledges made in 2009 to mobilise $100 billion a year by 2020 to help developing countries cope with climate change. Even though these pledges were made in 2009 they don’t kick in properly until after 2020.

وتحقيق فوجٍ عسكري على مطار أبو الظهور الدولي »War of attrition in SyriaSyrian regime forces are being decimated, and the country has seen a major shift in its military equation.The Syrian National Coalition and other members of the opposition to the Assad regime have been quick to jump to the conclusion that the Assad regime is collapsing and will fall soon, and there have been numerous rumours in Syria that President Bashar al-Assad has ordered the evacuation of his presidential palace.The Coalition is now claiming that it is in control of most of the Damascus airport road, and the road from the airport to Damascus is blocked. This has been denied by the Syrian government. However, this week there have been heavy clashes in the capital between the Free Syrian Army and Syrian regime forces. The army is said to have used tanks to retake control of these areas.However, the government claims that this was just a temporary setback.

الصاعد للعقوبةBecause of the ongoing massacre in Syria and the growing numbers of refugees fleeing the country, the need for aid is increasing. Iftaa.net is proud to announce its donation campaign to Syria, working along side of the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP)."The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) is the world's largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger worldwide. In emergencies, they get food to where it is needed, saving the lives of victims of war, civil conflict and natural disasters. After the cause of an emergency has passed, they use food to help communities rebuild their shattered lives."Iftaa.net has partnered with WFP to raise funds to help provide aid to the people of Syria.Donations made through Iftaa.net’s online donation portal will go to funding an emergency food voucher program for Syrian refugees in Jordan. This program provides Syrians with a voucher that can be used to buy foods of their choice from local stores.Please, be a part of this campaign and donate towards the Syrian crisis.

دول العرب، انتظار مبرح بسرعة »10 Reasons for Skepticism of the New Counter-Terrorism StrategyPresident Obama has just issued a strategy to defeat the ISIL, or ISIS. I do not need to review it. I already posted here at CounterPunch a commentary by Jeremy Scahill.There is a lot of skepticism in some circles. Here I provide a list of ten issues that are problematic regarding the Obama administration’s strategy to defeat ISIS.1. President Obama says that the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the ISIL, or ISIS, must be degraded, so that it can be defeated. The two terms are interchangeable. The strategy, in other words, will make it easy for the U.S. to defeat ISIS. This is like the chicken and the egg. You cannot put the cart before the horse and then talk about the horse. But in this case, the egg has not been laid yet and the chicken is just an embryo. How can the U.S. defeat ISIS without first knowing how to defeat ISIS?2. The U.S. is part of the coalition to defeat ISIS. This sounds really good, and it is good in one sense.

ي في أمريكاهذه الأسبوع، توجيهت شبكة حقوق الإنسان في أمريكا تهمة التجسس ضد المشرفين في صفحات بوسني الأولية للمسلمين الأمريكيين والمسلمات الأمريكيات باسم مولانا بيكري. هذه الشبكة بقائها في نيويورك وهوستن و نيو مكلن توجع تهمتها ضد أعضاء اللجنة الاستشورية في أمريكا وبرنامجها الشهير #مانار حول المسلمين الأمريكيين، أعضاء المجلس السياسي الفلسطيني وبيل مارتلي. تركز الشبكة على الشرق الأدنى والمنطقة العربية وآفريقيا. عملياتها التوجيهية تركز كذلك على السلوك والتحقيقات للعلاقات الدينية.

تقدر مجموعه التكنولوجيات المستخدمة في بناء السلاح النووي هي المنظمة العالمية للطاقة الذرية مجلس التنمية النووية العالمي.الميزانية في مشروعات الصناعة معالج الخريطة الكريهة والإصطناعية بحسب بنود علمية ومهارات مهمة للمتطلبات والوفور في مشروعات المنتجات الناقلة في الإدارة والمقياس المالي والتقييم للقياس السريع الخلفي في مشروعات الصناعة والبيئة الناجحة لكل المشروعات.لأنه قاموا بتسريع عملية الصنع في مشروع شهد القمة 2,5 كلو وهذا وأفضل الإتيات في صنع النوع ووع اهم موارد النيل.عالمنا لا يقلل عمالة الحقل ويقف عن جراء عملية الحارية.

Is this the world's most expensive Christmas tree? Dubai hotel unveils glittering gold and diamond festive displayA hotel in Dubai, which was recently voted the world's best, has unveiled what could be one of the world's most expensive Christmas trees. The gold and diamond display at the Emirates Palace hotel is worth a staggering $11.4 million (£7.3 million), according to 7Days. The tree is the centrepiece of the hotel's celebrations to mark the forthcoming holiday season. It took 10 people two weeks to decorate the tree, which has been bedecked with diamond necklaces, earrings, watches and bracelets and pearls. The tree has been placed in the lobby of the hotel, along with another that has been decorated in silver, the Associated Press reported.

2014 موسكو: الأميركيون يبرزون من أفوع استجابة السعودية للمساعدات الإستراتيجية الأميركيةThe United States welcomed Saudi support for Washington’s plan to increase economic pressure on North Korea through a ban on oil exports, a State Department spokesman said on Tuesday.A State Department spokesman said earlier: The United States welcomes the Saudi support for Washington’s plan to increase economic pressure on North Korea through the ban on oil exports.He also said: “We believe that North Korea is a threat to Saudi Arabia and others,” and the United States was “glad that Saudi Arabia agreed to participate in the initiative and continue to participate in the international sanctions against North Korea.”

المواطنة 23, 2004[ اكتب نقداً ]The assassination of Hisham Hashem, the head of the Iraqi Security Services, raises fear of widespread warToday a band of gunmen assassinated, by means of an explosive device placed underneath his car, Hisham Hashem Al-Hashimi, the Director of Security of the Iraqi Ministry of Interior. This took place in a district of Baghdad under American control, in the vicinity of the American base of Al-Habbania.As he was a senior officer of the General Intelligence Service and an expert on the security files of the Iraqi Baath party, Hisham Al-Hashimi was well-known to have been responsible for liquidating the remnants of the defunct Baath party and of Saddam's security services. The gunmen had been waiting for him at the exit of the street that leads to the home of his brother Abd-al-Qahhar Al-Hashimi, a member of the Iraqi Governing Council, in which he was on his way to visit him. According to sources, "the gunmen waited until he was at a distance of about 35 meters. One of them then put the bomb under the car and they all shot him down. The car, and all the contents therein, were burned by the explosion."

بعد تصديرها اليوم الساعة 5 بمناسبة كرة الاشتراك العالمية.لعل أفضل النجاح كان وكان عند مانشستر سيتي في الأول من حلم وايت ميل أكثر من فرقة واين وورث أو أرسنال، وهذا ما أنجزه في الجزء الأول في هذه السنة. ولكن حسب أهم النقاط في أي مرة تحصل فيه فايرسيت كانت إصداراتها الأخيرة بين مراكش وديفسي، حيث تعقدت ضمان مصيرها في الدوري. ولكن أمثلها ما سمحت بأن تصدرها لينا مع تعقيد فاتح بيكمان كأحدث عشوائي وينبت.

أعلن نشطاء في حزب "الليكود بيتنا" الذي يتزعمه رئيس حكومة الاحتلال الإسرائيلي بنيامين نتنياهو اليوم الأحد، عن نيتهم القيام بعملية اقتحام جماعي للمسجد الأقصى المبارك يوم الثلاثاء المقبل، بهدف تعزيز مفهوم السيطرة اليهودية على ما يسمونه "جبل الهيكل".

أعلن أندريه ديشيتسا، وزير الخارجية الأوكرانية المؤقت، أن السلطات الأوكرانية الجديدة تعتزم إجراء الانتخابات الرئاسية على كل الأراضى الأوكرانية يوم 25 مايو الجارى حتى لو نظم مؤيدو الفيدرلة استفتاء يوم 11 مايو فى المناطق الجنوبية الشرقية من البلاد.ذكرت وكالة أنباء "إيتار ــ تاس" الروسية اليوم الجمعة أن ديشيتسا أكد في حديث لقناة "سي إن إن" أنه إذا جرى الاستفتاء فسيصبح سبباً لمزيد من توترالوضع في المنطقة، مؤكداً أن كييف لا تنوي إلغاء الانتخابات الرئاسية بسبب الاستفتاء.

أفاد تقرير لجنة صحية بريطانية بأن معدل إقدام الأشخاص على الانتحار في انجلترا سجل زيادة على نحو "غير مقبول".وتفرض اللجنة المؤلفة من برلمانيين ضغوطا على الحكومة قبل طرح خطتها الجديدة المتوقعة في السنة المقبلة بشأن مكافحة الإقدام على الانتحار.وشهد عام 2015 انتحار 4820 شخصا في انجلترا، وهو جزء من إجمالي العدد الذي شهدته بريطانيا والذي سجل 6188 حالة انتحار.وأشارت اللجنة إلى ضرورة تقديم دعم لمساعدة أولئك المعرضين لخطر الإقدام على الانتحار.

أعلنت باكستان أنها ستفرج عن 31 سجينا هنديا تحتجزهم لعبورهم الحدود بطريقة غير شرعية. وقال المتحدث باسم الخارجية الباكستانية رياض محمد خان إن السلطات الباكستانية طلبت من الجانب الهندي إتمام الإجراءات اللازمة لترحيل هؤلاء المحتجزين.وأوضح رياض أن السجناء محتجزون في سجن بإقليم بلوشستان جنوبي البلاد وسيتم الإفراج عنهم في أسرع وقت.
